definition: to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)

sentences.english: Sustained efforts to improve credit and collateral registries offer large pay-offs.
sentences.chinese: 持續努力的改善信用狀況和抵押登記有助於清償債務。

sentences.english: The first thing to do in your hunt for debt-destroying cash is to stop wasting money.
sentences.chinese: 而尋找償債資金的第一步就是停止浪費金錢。

sentences.english: This removed debtservice from the politics of annual appropriations.
sentences.chinese: 這樣就將償債剝離於年度撥款的政治活動。
爲可預見的事準備好償債基金。

sentences.english: Kirlin said the city should suspend its debt payments during the recession.
sentences.chinese: Kirlin認爲，經濟衰退期間費城應該暫停償債。

sentences.english: The settlement agreement shall stipulate the period in which the enterprise shall repay the debts.
sentences.chinese: 和解協議應當規定企業清償債務的期限。

sentences.english: This is why the issue of national solvency goes beyond what governments owe.
sentences.chinese: 這就是國家的償債能力要比政府債務更加重要的原因。

sentences.english: The recession has hit everything from philanthropy to stripping to the solvency of Nevada.
sentences.chinese: 衰退已經橫掃了一切，包括從慈善事業到償債能力。

sentences.english: That's just a drop in the bucket . I need too much to get back on my feet.
sentences.chinese: 那只是杯水車薪，我需要一大筆錢來清償債務。

sentences.english: At regular intervals, the corporation deposits cash into this sinking fund.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期把現金存入償債基金。

sentences.english: Industry pays debts , while despair increases them.
sentences.chinese: 懇勤可以清償債務，失望只會徒增債務。

sentences.english: Of course, this form of truth-telling would have revealed insolvency at many financial firms.
sentences.chinese: 當然，這一形勢將揭露許多無力清償債務的金融企業。

definition: to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
(of a sum of money etc) receivable
to deal with/to wait on/to provide for
to lend money (for interest)/to give credit
